source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/HealthKit/nutrition-type-identifiers
crawled: 2025-12-02T18:10:00Z
---

# Nutrition Type Identifiers

**API Collection**

Type identifiers used for tracking diet and nutrition.

## Overview

Nutritional data can be broadly categorized into two main groups:

- Macronutrients consumed in large quantities, such as fats, carbohydrates, and proteins.
- Micronutrients consumed in smaller quantities, such as vitamins and minerals.

HealthKit also provides type identifiers for nutrition-related items that users may want to track, like water or caffeine.

You do not need to track all nutritional information; you can focus on the items of interest to your users. In general, the data from nutrition labels is a good place to start. Many countries and regions require a nutrition label on packaged food. While the contents of these labels vary from one country or region to another, they typically include the nutritional data represented by these properties:

- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryEnergyConsumed]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryFatTotal]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryFatSaturated]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryCholesterol]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryCarbohydrates]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryFiber]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietarySugar]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryProtein]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryCalcium]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryIron]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryPotassium]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietarySodium]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryVitaminA]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryVitaminC]
- [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryVitaminD]

### Combine Nutritional Samples

Macronutrient identifiers can be thought of as a hierarchy. The [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryEnergyConsumed] identifier represents the total amount of energy from all fats, carbohydrates, and protein. You can provide a detailed breakdown using the [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryFatTotal], [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryCarbohydrates], and [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryProtein] identifiers. Fats can be further separated into [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryFatMonounsaturated], [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryFatPolyunsaturated], and [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryFatSaturated]. Carbohydrates can be identified as [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryFiber] and [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietarySugar].

Unless your app is very focused (for example, tracking only sugar or saturated fat), always provide the total data ([doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryFatTotal] or [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryCarbohydrates]), and then optionally provide the more detailed information using the subcategories. You do not need to provide data for all of the subcategories; however, the sum of the subcategory sample values should be equal or less than the total sample’s value.



## Essentials

- **food**: Food correlation types combine any number of nutritional samples into a single food object.
- **HKMetadataKeyFoodType**: The type of food that the HealthKit object represents.

## Macronutrients

- **dietaryEnergyConsumed**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of energy consumed.
- **dietaryCarbohydrates**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of carbohydrates consumed.
- **dietaryFiber**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of fiber consumed.
- **dietarySugar**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of sugar consumed.
- **dietaryFatTotal**: A quantity sample type that measures the total amount of fat consumed.
- **dietaryFatMonounsaturated**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of monounsaturated fat consumed.
- **dietaryFatPolyunsaturated**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of polyunsaturated fat consumed.
- **dietaryFatSaturated**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of saturated fat consumed.
- **dietaryCholesterol**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of cholesterol consumed.
- **dietaryProtein**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of protein consumed.

## Vitamins

- **dietaryVitaminA**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of vitamin A consumed.
- **dietaryThiamin**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of thiamin (vitamin B1) consumed.
- **dietaryRiboflavin**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of riboflavin (vitamin B2) consumed.
- **dietaryNiacin**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of niacin (vitamin B3) consumed.
- **dietaryPantothenicAcid**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of pantothenic acid (vitamin B5) consumed.
- **dietaryVitaminB6**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of pyridoxine (vitamin B6) consumed.
- **dietaryBiotin**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of biotin (vitamin B7) consumed.
- **dietaryVitaminB12**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of cyanocobalamin (vitamin B12) consumed.
- **dietaryVitaminC**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of vitamin C consumed.
- **dietaryVitaminD**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of vitamin D consumed.
- **dietaryVitaminE**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of vitamin E consumed.
- **dietaryVitaminK**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of vitamin K consumed.
- **dietaryFolate**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of folate (folic acid) consumed.

## Minerals

- **dietaryCalcium**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of calcium consumed.
- **dietaryChloride**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of chloride consumed.
- **dietaryIron**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of iron consumed.
- **dietaryMagnesium**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of magnesium consumed.
- **dietaryPhosphorus**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of phosphorus consumed.
- **dietaryPotassium**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of potassium consumed.
- **dietarySodium**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of sodium consumed.
- **dietaryZinc**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of zinc consumed.

## Hydration

- **dietaryWater**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of water consumed.

## Caffeination

- **dietaryCaffeine**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of caffeine consumed.

## Ultratrace Minerals

- **dietaryChromium**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of chromium consumed.
- **dietaryCopper**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of copper consumed.
- **dietaryIodine**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of iodine consumed.
- **dietaryManganese**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of manganese consumed.
- **dietaryMolybdenum**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of molybdenum consumed.
- **dietarySelenium**: A quantity sample type that measures the amount of selenium consumed.
